intro: Otopappus syncephalus, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Otopappus syncephalus is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
